turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Saugerties (village), New York.
turn.1: What is the difference between Saugerties and Slingerlands?
turn.2: Saugerties (village), New York  Saugerties () is a village in Ulster County, New York, United States.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: The Village of Saugerties is located on the west bank of the Hudson River, at the mouth of the Esopus Creek.
turn.6: It is in the eastern part of the Town of Saugerties.
turn.7: Is it near any major routes?
turn.8: U.S. Route 9W and New York State Route 32 pass through the village, converging at its center and overlapping to the south.
turn.9: Are there any other routes nearby?
turn.10: These routes parallel the New York State Thruway (Interstate 87), which passes through the town a mile west of the village.
turn.11: What was the first person to settle in the area?
turn.12: In the 1650s Barent Cornelis Volge operated a sawmill on the Sawyer's Kill, supplying lumber for the manor of Rensselaerswick.
